text: 16 ounce can. Orange body with light haze and some citrus and light malt. No date on the can though.
Big balls on this. More in IPA territory. Great Every day hazy IPA, lots of tropical fruit, nice mouthfeel, long finish. I would love to try the DDH version of this.
Hhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhh via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Wow, a top 5 world pale ale. I am on board. Hazy yellow orange New England appearance, a lasting, messy white head on top. The aroma is great, juicy orange, mango, grapefruit rind. The flavor kills it, a real beermosa in beer, non-mosa form, but better and not for wimps. The juice is loose, but not in a scary way like if OJ had it out for you. Dry flavors of orange, pineapple, and mango. I can almost see pulp. Medium bodied and rough on the feel, but in a good way. Dayum this be tasty.

UPDATED: MAY 23, 2017 Pours a very hazy, yellow-orange, not unlike fresh-squeezed orange juice. Good-sized, though quickly-dissipating head. Powerful citrus aroma, with some hops present. Flavor is citrusy, with tropical fruit and loads of hop bite. Really topnotch beer.

Can - Hazy amber pour with a ring of white head. Nose isnt super pungent--light tropical hopping and a light malt base. Taste is better--lots of fruity hops with a dry bready makt base. Pretty one dimensional but that dimension is really nice.

Draft @ The Rare Barrel, Berkeley, CA. Pours a hazy golden color with a small white head. Has a fruity malty peachy hoppy aroma. Fruity malty peachy hoppy citrus flavor. Has a fruity malty peachy hoppy citrus finish.

Can from the source. Pours hazy dark orange with large whitish foamy head, orange peel aroma, high carbonation, medium bitter orange peel taste, very smooth body, long medium bitter orangey finish. Very smooth and delicious, glides over your tongue and down your throat like nectar!

Trillium Fort Pale Ale. Bela breja! Aroma com leve resinoso, com maracujá explosivo vindo em seguida. Corpo aveludado. Ótima! 4/5

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

16 oz can. Pours a hazy and turbid golden orange color and topped by a small smooth head of off white foam that settles quickly to a thin film. The aroma is really nice and juicy showing loads of tropical fruit with notes of orange, grapefruit, mango, and stone fruit to go with the bready malts, light pine resin, and citrus hops. The flavor follows suit with the juicy orange, grapefruit, mango, peach, and passion fruit up front and are balanced out nicely by the toasted bread malts, light pine and citrus hop bitterness. There is a nice dryness to it all from the hop bitterness. Medium plus in body and incredibly smooth and easy to drink with ample carbonation that leads to a dry, bitter sweet finish with lingering notes of orange and grapefruit. This one drinks more like an IPA at this abv, but I love how dry it finishes. Really delicious stuff. Fantastic pale ale.

[2/3/17] Can at the hostel in Boston. Murky golden with a white head. Great juicy fruity hops aroma full of tropical fruits. Dry flavor, slightly tart, with nice fruity hops. Medium-bodied. Very good and refreshing.

Happy Birthday to me! Pours a cloudy yellow with a small but tenacious white head that leaves nice lacing. Nose is a burst of ripe tropical fruits and is way less onion-y than your usual Trillium. It almost has a texture also, lol. Surreal. Full of resin, too. Taste is moderately bitter and a little boozy. Floury cereals. More fruits and pine. Body is light to medium, carbonation moderate and mouthfeel is fluffy. Quite assertive but never harsh, it could do without that alcohol warmth, though. Overall a really pleasing neo american pale ale! Trillium at its best!

Tallboy can from Fort Point pours New England style. Aroma of citrus, mango and peach along with some dry grains. Body is thinner with bubbly carbonation and a quicker fading aftertaste. Flavor of old marmalade topped toast, light apricot skins, peach and dry citrus rind.
Can at home. Pours hazy golden with a medium white head. Aroma is tropical with some citrus, taste is very tropical with a citrusy touch. Really good for a pale ale!

Can @ Overtryksventilen. Pours muddy orange with a White head. Aroma of tropical fruits, juicy - hop pallets, ripe peach. Taste is heavy tropical, slight touch grapefruit - very balanced between tropical and juicy charater. Outstanding.

Can shared at the Christmas Party tonight. Slightly hazy deep yellow with a moderate white head. Tropical earthy citrus and pine on the nose and flavor. Decent bready malt backbone. Tasty beer for sure.
Can thanks to Jez. Would have to be one of the best Pales Ive ahd hands down. Insane balance and length. World class in every way

Pale orange yellow as expected, slightly more bitter and classic citrus rhind flavor than expected. Less juicy than the galaxy version, less dank than the Nelson, less juicy and more pithy than the galaxy. Aaaand yet another addition to the top tier of pale ales. 
Though it drinks more like an IPA :)
Between 42 and 43, so if my score fluctuates, thats why.

Draft at the brewery. Pours opaque gold with a bubbly white head. Tastes like grapefruit hops, resin, lemon, and some pine. Light/medium body and low carbonation. Smells like grapefruit hops, resin, lemon, and some pine.
Tap at brewery. Pours hazy yellow/gold. Aroma and flavor are citrus, orange peel, toasted malts, pale malt, and faint grassiness. Medium body.

Pounder can via PUBR. Pours hazy straw with white head. Hops, citrus, florals in the nose. Smooth flavor, complex, dense, hops paired with tropical citrus, florals, and a very smooth finish. Incredible APA.

475 ml can. Hazy golden orange color with white head. Hoppy aroma, grassy, floral, pine, citrusy fruity, tropical fruits, light malty notes. Light sweet and moderate bitter taste. Medium to full oily body with soft carbonation.

Got in a BIF from oline73. 16 ounce can into signature tulip glass, canned on 9/16/2016. Pours hazy golden orange color with a 1-2 finger fairly dense and fluffy off white head with good retention, that reduces to a nice cap that lingers. Nice spotty soapy lacing clings on the glass, with a fair amount of streaming carbonation. Aromas of grapefruit, tangerine, pineapple, peach, passion fruit, papaya, mango, lemon/orange peel, light pine, wheat, cracker, bread, herbal, and floral/grassy earthiness. Damn nice aromas with great balance and complexity of juicy citrus/tropical/pine hops and moderate bready malt notes; with good strength. Taste of big grapefruit, tangerine, pineapple, peach, passion fruit, papaya, mango, lemon/orange peel, light pine, wheat, cracker, bread, herbal, and floral/grassy earthiness. Light-moderate pine/grassy/citrus rind bitterness on the finish; with lingering notes of grapefruit, tangerine, pineapple, peach, passion fruit, papaya, mango, lemon/orange rind, pine, wheat, cracker, bread, and herbal/floral/grassy earthiness on the finish for a while. Fantastic complexity, robustness, and balance of juicy citrus/tropical/pine hops and moderate bready malt flavors; with a great malt/bitterness balance, and minimal lingering hop astringency after the finish. Light-moderate dryness from bitterness, increasing through the glass. Medium carbonation and body; with a very smooth, moderately sticky/resinous, and creamy/grainy balanced mouthfeel that is great. Zero warming alcohol as expected of 6.6%. Overall this is an outstanding pale ale. All around awesome complexity, robustness, and balance of juicy citrus/tropical/pine hops and moderate bready malt flavors; very smooth and easy to drink. Not quite as vibrant and aromatic as some of their other beers, and more resinous/drying in the mouthfeel; but still highly enjoyable.
Can shared with the DB guys. Light hazy yellowish pour with a frothy head. Tons of juicy mangoes, orange, some pine, light floral and some light bitterness. Juicy and good!

16oz can purchased on site at Trillium in Fort Point. Pours thick, dark burnt orange, very hazy. Smooth, frothy head with minimal bubbles. Smells of pure columbus hops through and through with a slight citrus and floral kick. Very hoppy, bitter but citrusy taste with a hint of malt. Great flavor. Full mouthfeel, sudzy, smooth and lasting. Very strong beer. Another Great Trillium beer. The King of Pale Ales.

Can courtesy of Lucas and Vestergaard. Thanks guys. Hazy yellow with a white head. Aroma is sweet, malty and rather hoppy - grapefruit. Flavor is medium sweet and moderate bitter. Dry and moderate bitter finish. Nice and really fresh. 061016
Cloudy orange gold, light white head. Brilliant mango, orange, sweet. Fairly bitter, quite sweet. Chewy, lighter body. Medium finish. Excellent.
Can. Pours hazy juicy orange with a small white head. Aromas of dank herbs, citrus, orange peel, earthy hops, sweat, grass. Taste is dank, herbal, melony, orange, peach, grass.

Can. Pours Hazy amber with a white head. Aroma of dank hops, mellow citrus fruits, sweet mango, apricot, papaya, pineapple and all that juice! The taste is extremely freaking crushable and juicy. Tropical citrus fruits, dank hops, low bitterness and slight pine. I mean, Cmon! GESUNDHEIT!!!

loneliness is an artform .. . light hazy gold .. medium head, great lacing .. spruce, grass, dead grass, and citrus .. mouth is on point .. long finish for a pale .. very tasty liquid .. . . Ed Rush used to be a proper skinhead

Really great beer. Heavy citrus on the nose, like a brighter-smelling Cascade mixed with a bit of tropical. But more grapefruit scent. Body is amazing - thick on the palate like a German wheat. Finish is about dead on - not sweet/malty, but not dry, which means just right. Flavor is very much like a Grapefruit Sculpin, with slightly toned down grapefruit. Really a great beer.
Can thanks to art. Poured hazy dark yellow with white head. Aroma sweet piney dank. Light carb med bod. Taste balanced grassy hop.

750mL bottle. Pours cloudy gold with a medium white head. Aroma of tropical fruit and pine. Tastes is much the same, but with the addition of some breadiness. Moderate bitterness on the finish. Strong malt presence. Light carbonation. Medium body. Full, heavy mouthfeel.
Damn good APA! Cloudy. Looks like orange juice. Smooth, creamy, malty, crisp wth citrusy hops. Some stickiness and dankness. Citrus and some floral notes on the nose.

Comparison post Regular v galaxy

Regular: pours a beautiful cloudy golden with one finger head with moderate lacing. Aromas of lemon, tropical fruit, a little resin. Slightly malt backbone. Hint of sweet up front, then turns moderately bitter. moderate to full body with long slightly bitter finish.

Excellent beer.

Galaxy: pours a beautiful cloudy golden *slightly dark than the original* with one finger head with moderate lacing. Aromas of lemon, tropical fruit, a little resin. *More prominent mango in my opinion.* Slightly malt backbone. Hint of sweet up front which is slightly more in the Galaxy version*, then turns moderately bitter. moderate to full body with long slightly bitter finish.

Also, quite excellent
Pours hazy golden orange. White head. A lot of mango, pine, tropical fruit on the nose. Flavor is pine, grapefruit, tangerine, mango. Good mouthfeel.

Tap at the source, Canton. Pours super hazy fruit juice, pale golden orange. White head. Aroma is lots of mango, pine, tropical fruit, just bursting, tangerine, grapefruit. Insane. Flavor is pine, slightly dank note, grapefruit, tangerine, mango. Really damn good. Medium heavy mouthfeel, not overly effervescent.
Poured a hazy light orange with a white head. Aroma was of tropical and cat pee, yum. Flavor similar, a bit more bitter than some of their others. Overall another great beer from these guys.

Bottle from the South Boston brewery, packaged on 4/5/16. Poured into a tulip glass a cloudy gold with a thick soapy head that dissipates quickly, heavy lacing. Deep citrus and pine on the nose, juicy fruit flavors, full bodied with a dry, subtle hop finish.

Sample at Trillium Canton with koleminer20. Aroma is juicy, pine, tropical fruit, citrus, yowza. Appearance is golden, hazy, white head. Taste is juicy, sweet tropical fruit, citrus, some dankness, lovely. Mouthfeel is light body, light crisp carbonation, juicy fruit and resin aftertaste. Overall, good lord this is wonderful.

On draft at Trillium Canton. The pour is an ugly juicy darker golden orange with w thicker white head that falls to a thick collar leaving good lace. The aroma is magic. Its juicy and brightly hopped with a citrusy dominance. This smells like orange juice mixed with a tropical fruit. I love it. The flavor is excellent. There is a big juiciness to it and a hint of bitter. Its just lovely. The juiciness rolls into a leafy hop and it just finishes juicy and beautiful. The mouth feel is excellent. Light and crisp with a beautiful carbonation and a lingeringly toy tropical orange juiciness. Damn.

Véritable explosion de fruits en bouche. Des pêches, du pamplemousse, du citron, des oranges. La couleur est belle, un beau jaune orangée, et le liquide est tellement facile à boire, un peu damertume tellement mince que cen en devient hyper agréable. La bière nest pas si complexe, mais la profondeur du gout du houblon est réellement solide. Jen prendrais à tous les jours. Wow.
Pours a juicy looking pale orange pour with a white head. Aromas of peaches and grapefruit. Taste is juicy, lightly sweet up front with a slight crisp bitter finish. Great balance.

750 ml bottle from the brewery. Pours a cloudy yellow orange gold with a medium white head. Aroma of grapefruit, pineapple, mango, peach,hops and pine needles. Taste of orange, grapefruit, mango, peach and hops.
Just had a sample but is was very nice. Juicy sweet aroma and smooth drinking. Deep flavors, hoppy with some citrus and slightly bitter. A great aftertaste. Would love to drink more

75cl bottle. Murky apple cider body topped by small off-white head. Aroma is moderately sweet, tangerine, some orange, lemon, light spicy. Taste is moderately sweet, lemon/orange, some grapefruit. Tangy. Light-medium body, light resin.

Hazy orange juice looking pour. Sizable white head that falls quickly to soapy suds. No lacing. Orange aroma and slight roasted corn that I seem to pick up with too many hops left in for too long. Taste is orange and bitter peel.

Tasted on 4/13/16 from a capped 750mL bottle, big thanks to Alex for sharing. Pours cloudy dark yellow with an average white head that slowly recedes to average, smooth lace. The nose is both dank and fruity hops, with some nice earthy aroma, mango, pineapple, and a very light peppery touch. The flavor is even more tropical fruit, light pepper and dank, and just a bit more bread than on the nose. The body is medium with average carbonation, and a long nicely bitter and tropical fruit finish.

750ml bottle from share at dmacs. Poured a cloudy pale yellow color with a small foamy white head. Aroma of juicy pineapple, mango, sweet citrus juice, cat piss, and honey. Taste of pineapple, grain, lemon zest, cat piss, oranges, and pine.

750 mL bottle poured into a snifter. Originally reviewed 6/2/2014.

Hazy orange body. Nice white head. Some lacing.

Initially, the smell is a little dank, but it moves more toward the citrus end quickly. Orange. A little lemon.

A little less dynamic in the taste. Orange. Grapefruit. Some pine. Grainy cracker malt. Mild grassy hop bitterness in the back.

Medium light body. Drops off quickly. Mild bitterness.

Really nice hop aroma. Doesnt quite live up to the heights of its aroma, but its very drinkable.

Excellent hop aroma. Love the look of this beer and the taste even more. The hop flavor comes through without too much bitter. Fantastic balance. I will drink this morning noon and night, if given the opportunity and budget.
Phenomenal hop aroma without a bitter or malty flavor, a very good pale ale. Fruity, light, really tasty
Bottle. Pours cloudy yellow with white head and lacing. Nose is orange and pineapple. Taste adds some lemon. Good.

Bottle. Pours Hazy Straw color with thick off white head. Aroma is Grapefruit, Papaya and Pine. Taste is fruity grapefruit, pineapple, papaya with a hoppy pine finish. First trillium beer and i really like it.

Pours a cloudy pale light golden color with virtually no head. Aroma is of big time hops, citrus, pine and weeds. Nice heavy palate. Flavor is more of a drier citrus hop flavor. Hops, grass, and weeds really show up. Leaves a dry citrus hop finish. Pretty damn good!

UPDATED: AUG 15, 2016 Bomber from Julios. Pours out super cloudy light orange. Bready-citrus-pine fruit aroma and flavors. Medium dry bitterness. Tasty, but quite disappointing. Re-rate: Canned version from Canton. Must be a much fresher batch! Quite tasty and enjoyable.

750ml bottle from the brewery bottled on the 19/02. Aroma: wow! That aroma consists on fresh pineapples and citrus and a tiny tiny tad peppery. App: really hazy unfiltered straw / pear, medium white head, ok retention, great lacing. Awesome look. Taste and palate: light to medium body, light sweetness, fruity but at the limit of being watery, dry light crisp bitter finish. Overall: good stuff! Really easy to drink. There must an incredible amount of hops added at the end of the boiling since it?s so fruity in nose but not much bitter. Really well made.

Bottle brought back by a new bud making quarterly trips. Pours clear pale golden, off white reasonable head. Nose is tropical fruit, pale malts and maybe hints of pine and garlic. Fuller bodied. Tropical fruits, pineapple, balanced malt backing. Loads of flavor for the abv. Will need more

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Tons of tropical fruit, especially pineapple, and citrus in the aroma, but also in the flavor. The other most notable feature of this not-quite-India pale ale is its cloudy appearance and very silky mouthfeel. 

Not overly hoppy, but still packed with flavor, this one almost a gateway to the dank, juicy IPAs. Its eminently drinkable.

Another great New England hoppy beer from Trillium. This leans more towards a full IPA than a pale ale, but thats splitting hairs. Its got a lot of strong citrus and orange juice flavor from the hops, some crisp malt flavor, and a pretty creamy, full mouthfeel. Not as mind-blowing as the Double Dry Hopped version, but still miles better than almost any other pale ale.
750 ml. bottle. Pours a hazy gold with a nice white head. Big aroma of citrus, tropical, and malt. Taste is pineapple, lemon, grapefruit, orange, pine, grass, and malt. Superb.

Bottle... Pours cloudy and yellow with a tiny, creamy, white head. Decent retention. The aroma is a collection of musky armpit, citrus rinds, lemon and cracker malt. Medium-bodied with soft, airy carbonation. The flavor features a moderate measure of citrusy and rindy bitterness accompanied by a light ration of breadiness. Bright, refreshing finish. Nicely balanced overall. Bottle courtesy of ctipping!
Pours a hazy yellow with a thick white head. Aroma of grapefruit, grass and earth. Taste follows, bitter and crisp. This is how I would like every hoppy beer to be.
Another wonderful NE hoppy beer. So soft on the palette. Triocsl fruit, light nuances of yeast and just awesome.
750 thanks to bytemesis. Top of bottle pours mostly clear pale; bottom mostly hazy gold. Juicy citrus nose. Moderately sweet, light-to-moderate bitterness. Goes down easy. Real nice.
750ml. Lightly hazed golden with great head. Nicely restrained yet full of fruit and tropical notes. Balanced malt, wheat, fruity hops. Super drinkable.

Big citrus passion fruit dank cracker wheat. Fresh and awesome nose. Smells rare. Hazy orange golden pour great head and lace. Great looking beer. Tropical fruit passion fruit sweat melon grapefruit dank cracker wheat. Smooth fruity delicious. Drink ability is very high. Fuck yeah.

Real Hazy light pumpkin orange color. Good retention. The aroma flies out of the bottom once opened. Big grapefruit rind aromatics from the hops, as well as big fresh hop aromatics an herbal grassy quality. Medium mouthfeel with a solid malt backbone. The hop aromatics come off slightly sweet like the first bite of a citrus fruit. It finishes with a smooth bitterness. Solid beer.

Une mousse moyenne mais bien compacte se pose sur une bière orangée très trouble. Une explosion dagrumes se fraie un chemin dans mes narines, avec, en plus, quelques effluves épicés. Une véritable bombe fruitée en bouche, une présence timide des céréales vient créer une belle symbiose. La finale est plutôt amère et assez sèche. Un vrai plaisir à boire.

Bottle shared by my friend Bruce. Pours cloudy golden with a thick white head and a citrus aroma. There is a hearty pale malt flavor with a perfect bitter citrus kick at the finish. Well-balanced, well-made.
Bottle shared by Bruce. Pours cloudy copper with white head. Taste is Tropical fruit and bitter finish

750ml bottle thanks to red beard. Pours out a hazy straw topped with a white head. Nose is nice tropical fruit citrus pineapple and some melon. Taste is more of the tropical fruit mix and nice hop and malt balance.

Gracieuseté dun ami à qui jen dois toute une! Mademoiselle Irina et moi dégustons cette bière sublime en accompagnement dun saumon grillé à la teryaki et de légumes sautés. Dès la capsule sautée, un torrent dagrumes explosent dans la cuisine! Du pamplemousse, de la mandarine, de la mangue, de la pêche et de la poire. Toutes ces arômes proviennent de houblons magnifiques mais nous ne sommes pas dans la IPA. En bouche le liquide est plutôt mince, très effervescent et surtout si bien balancé entre le houblon et le malt. Non ce nest certainement pas une IPA. Presque aucune amertume, pleine de saveurs dagrumes sur un fond de céréales jeunes et blondes. Texture soyeuse et souple, cette bière est un émerveillement pour mon palais!

Bottle shared at Kernel. 

Super impressive drinkability, super clean, really good clean malt. Seriously this is one of the best pale ales I have ever had. Drinks incredibly well. One of the softest malt mouthfeels I have ever experienced. Id love to know what malt theyre using as they are killing it. So dank.

UPDATED: DEC 15, 2015 Really nice hazy look. Aroma is full of citrus fruits and the taste follows it. Makes me think of something like a sweet lemon or lime. Body feels quite light but smooth and easy drinking. Bitterness is quite low for such an intense hoppiness. Definitely one of the best pale ales I ever had. It combines the intense, citrusy hoppiness with an easy to drink, refreshing base beer.
Bottle courtesy of Mike, thank you! Hazy to cloudy golden color. Huge mango and pineapple aroma, wow! Taste has bitter bright tropical fruit, nicely balanced. Fantastic.

Bottle shared by Michael T. Thanks man.

Yellow body, medium haze, quarter inch of white head. Lovely hop forward aroma. Citric hops, silky elegant body. Super drinkable / enjoyable. Light bodied and delicious.

Location: 750 ml bottle from the brewery, 8/12/15, Bottled 7/28/15


Aroma: Wonderful aroma that starts off tropical and citrusy, with mango and papaya, some citrus zest, very bright and fruity overall, with herbal and resiny hints, and a bit of pale malt

Appearance: Pours an unclear orange color with a frothy white head and mid-heavy lacing

Flavor: It tastes much like it smells, fruity, with a bit of sweetness, and a clean hop bitterness

Palate: Medium bodied, smooth, clean, and extremely drinkable, with a soft feel and a dry close

Overall Impression: 
This is a beautiful APA.  Great all the way through from the aroma through the flavor.  Lives up to its reputation for sure.  One of the best new things I have tried in a while, and one of the best examples of the style I can ever remember trying.  Excellent.

It doesnt get much better than this for hop-forward beers. Citra shines with a bit of dankness and tons of Citrus on the aroma. Flavor is as juicy as it comes. hop kick up front, straight up OJ on the finish. Love

Growler from the brewery. Opaque apricot color with a white head. Mild tropical fruit hop aromas. Fruiry hop characteristics are mellowed by pine and resin notes. Somewhat bitter but with a sturdy enough malt backbone to keep it balanced. Good body and mouthfeel. A real solid pale ale.

Bomber from the brewery. To call it hazy is an under statement, this is a bright orange and basically opaque. Fluffy white head. Nose is very bright, lots of fresh orange, lemon, grapefruit, some starfruit, a little tropical fruit, some light candy, grass, some chive. Flavor is spritzy, lemon, orange juice, orange rind, grapefruit zest, light honey, scallion, light pine. Dry, zesty finish.

Aroma: Citrus Rind, Mildly Piney

Appearance: Hazy Golden Straw Hue, Passes Some Light, White Head Ring, Some Lacing

Taste: Dry Citrus Rind, Mildly Piney

Mouthfeel: Decent Carbonation, Medium Bodied, Mildly Drying
Bomber from trade. Very cloudy light golden pour. Strong mango and tropical aroma. Taste follows with little bitter hops at the very end. Very well balanced and delicious.
Bomber. Hazy orange pour with a frothy white head. Citrusy and herbal. Bold aroma elements with a soft easy drinking palate. This is awesome. Thanks Tom!

Bottle at Ryans June 2015 tasting. Pours a bright golden body with light haze and white lacing. Mouthfeel is soft and crisp with notes of fresh rgassy hop, mango, pineapple, funky hop, juicy character and clean pilsner malt. Really nice.

Fresh bottle, pours golden shade with medium sized head. Notes of orange, mango juice, pineapple and onion cheese hop. Medium body and bitterness. This one is a bit too big and sweet for a pale ale I want to session on. Its still a nice beer, but prefered the Galaxy doub dry hopped when I had it.

Lovely hazy golden pour. Tropical fruits aroma, smooth taste, some pine aftertaste. Very good. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle, courtesy of kermis. Pours a hazy golden beer with a big white head on top. Aroma is massive citric, tropical fruits, pineapple, peach. Flavour is light bitter, very, very fruity, mild carbonation and a nice, malty, caramel finish. Excellent stuff.

Bottle shared. Pours cloudy light orange with an off white head. Aroma of massive citrus, tropical fruits, lychee, peach and mango. Flavour is light moderate sweet and over moderate bitter. Light medium bodied with soft carbonation. Lovely stuff!

Bomber courtesy of and shared with Kermis. Big thanks.
Tropical fruit aroma. Thick creamy white head. Cloudy blond pour. Lovely bitterness. Wow. Great.
Bottle from brewery. Amazing tropical fruit aroma. Delicious fruity taste. An incredible pale ale.
Cloudy pale yellow pour with a white head. Really nice citrus hop nose. Crisp hoppy no bitterness totally crushable. Fine fine beer.

Hazy straw-orange body, medium sized white head, and dense soapy lacing. Papaya, mango, pineapple, orange rind, pine, and resin. Medium body with moderate to mellow carbonation, assertive bitterness, and a lingering and refreshing finish.

Bottle shared at craft ale house. Pours hazy golden with a medium sized white head and some haze. The aroma has big citrus, light pine, real juicy. The taste is very citrus forward with a medium bitterness. Well done.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

22 oz. bottle from ndaniels13. Thanks! It pours a hazy light yellow/orange color with a tall white head. The aroma is citric and juicy with lime, pineapple, papaya and a hint of more danky pine in there too. The flavor is the same with more strong citrus acidity, lime, orange, a little pineapple and a good low/medium bitterness with a touch of dank at the finish. Really crushable. I dont see a lot of difference between this and the Galaxy dry-hopped version, but I think I may have liked this one just a tad more.

Bottle (750 ml). From jcastle, thanks! Split 5-ways @ Hotel Room Tasting.

Appearance: Slightly hazy bright golden with a fluffy white head and heavy lacing. 

Aroma: Burst of weed at first followed by dank hops, onions, resin, tropical fruits and light herbal presence. Nice aromatic hops!

Taste: Onions, dank hops, a very good malt backbone, resin, tropical fruits and light bitterness. 

Palate: Light to medium body. Moderate carbonation. A bit oily. Smooth mouthfeel. Dry finish. 

Overall: A really nice dank Pale Ale with beautiful aromatic features and amazing drinkability. Tasty and quenching. World-class.
Aroma of Banana, papaya, pineapple, orange, mango, tangerine. Lace jungle on cloudy yellow. Ridiculously drinkable and tasty hop profile. Thanks TomTom for hooking me up.

Bottle. Pours murky light yellow with a thin white head that lingers. A hop forward pale ale with nice complexity. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Une belle bouteille partagée par des gens généreux, merci. Une robe jaune avec une mousse collante. Un nez de chanvre et doignon (je nai pas été le premier à le dire mais je lai senti). Cest surprenant mais ça sent bon. En bouche le liquide est passablement rond. Des saveurs chanvrées et citronnées sont bien présentes. Une finale longue et soyeuse termine la dégustation. Belle étiquette.

Blonde assez embrouillée avec une mousse blanche sale qui diminue paisiblement. Au nez, tangerine, ananas, herbes (citra?), poivre blanc et conifère. Au goût, les agrumes sont en jus tandis que le côté floral et les conifères prennent une belle place. Au palais, le corps est un peu mou. Au deuxième versement, le pétillement va bon train. En finale, cest bien sec et poivré. Belle bière de soif.  Merci les boys!

Bottle, hotel room tasting. Thick foamy white head, med lacing, glowing hazy gold pour. Aroma is really dank, nice hoppiness, light onion, citra dank, light cat piss really nice. Taste is light, soft bitterness, hoppy, light tropical fruit juice. Palate is light, soft carbonation. Nice.
Bottle. Hazy golden pour with white head. Herbal and grassy hop arlmas with a touch of citrus. Solid apa with grassy and citrus hop flavors. Surprising.

Bottle thanks to WillRunForBeer. Cloudy pale yellow pour with very little head. Juicy aroma with lots of pineapple and citrus, some dank wet grass, and light pine. Taste is juicy without being overly sweet. Big pineapple and oranges, some mangos and lemon, slightly dank too. Perfect mouthfeel. Nice peppery, spicy hop finish. Super smooth and easy to slam. Love this.

750 ml bottle poured into a Spiegelau tulip. Bottled 2/24/2015. Slightly hazy golden yellow with a good 3 fingers of off-white head. Nice lacing. Aromas of pine, citrus, some garlic/onion, light floral notes. Tastes of juicy grapefruit citrus and tropical fruits, floral, pine, a little mango. Medium body with a semi-dry finish. Medium carbonation, juicy mouthfeel. Delicious tropical citrusy pale ale.

Courtesy of umich03jm
Bottle: The aroma consists of big citrus, tropical fruits, pineapple, lemon peel, and dank hops. It pours a cloudy dull golden-orange with a small white head that quickly fades to a minimal film outlined by a soapy ring. The flavor starts with citrus, tropical fruits, and pineapple. The finish has light-moderate grapefruit, dank hops, and a touch of lemon. Its light bodied with soft carbonation and mouthfeel. Overall, this is a super tasty and crushable IPA.

Poured from bottle into a tulip: Pours golden / yellow with a nice white head. Aroma of citrus, grapefruit, orange, and other tropical goodness. Taste is more of the same with a nice dry, finish. Medium body, perfect carbonation, delicious beer.

Bottle from trade. Pours cloudy yellow gold like all the other Trilliums out there. Big fluffy/ccreamy white head that just sticks around forever. Pretty! Aroma is fantastic with lots of pineapple mango grapefruit, super tropical, papaya, light grass, a bit of lemon peel. Mhmmm. Flavor is dry pine and grass, less tropicalness as the smell might indicate, nice bitterness going on here, some pineapple and lots of bitter grapefruit skin. Interesting. Medium light bodied with adequate carbonation and a dry finish. Really nice. I was skeptical as to whether this would really be any different from the Galaxy Dry Hopped version, but this one seems a bit more dry and grassy, while the Galaxy version had big tropical notes. Both are fantastic brews.

The beer is a hazy orangey yellow. More than hazy, quite cloudy. Big white head. Glowy color. Lots of lacing. The aroma pops with fresh hoppiness. Theres a big pineapple note with pine, tangerine, grass and lime. It has that yeasty, minerally sharpness of the new wave of top hoppy beers. The taste is dry and full of hop flavor. Moderate bitterness, builds to medium bitter in the finish. Wonderful mineral character. Crisp and light. Mouthfeel is full, light and refreshing. Super easy to drink. Feels dangerously lighter than 6.6% abv. Excellent beer.

Bottle, courtesy of a kind soul... shared in a location remote of my dining room.
Pours a hazy blonde with a decent head and nice lacing on the glass.

The aroma is big & fruity and some mild garlic. its got a lot of great fresh aromatic hops with citrus & melon being the key players. Its a totally inviting bouquet. 

The flavor has a nice moderate bitterness and the beer is basically on the drier side of the pale ale spectrum. It finishes clean with a nice mild lingering bitterness. Its got plenty of fresh hoppiness, its fruit forward, bright, satisfying, and 100% huggable. 

Real tame.

5/I/15 - 75cl bottle @ home - BB: n/a, bottled: X/29/14 (2015-8) Thanks to jc1762 and his wife for sharing the bottle!
Little hazy bright orange beer, big creamy off-white head, irregular, pretty stable, adhesive, leaving a nice lacing in the glass. Aroma: really sweet exotic fruits, mango and passion fruit mainly. MF: ok carbon, medium body. Taste: fruity start, lots of citrus, more citrus, some pineapple. Aftertaste: pretty bitter, citrus, bit grassy lemony, fruity finish.

Pours a hazy orange with a medium creamy head. Aroma of fresh floral and citrusy american hops along with a touch of bready malt. Flavor was much of the same. Great american hop profile with just a touch of bready malt. Super crisp and dry. Loved it.

Bottle. Pours a beautiful, hazy pale orange. Aroma is citrus, tangerine, orange. Taste follows suit. The light bitterness is nicely balanced by the malt and the wonderful softness. It all works so well. Lightly dry. One of the best apas Ive ever had. Excellent.

Pours straw yellow. 

The nose is incredible - fresh grass, straw, ripe tropical fruits (mango, pineapple, etc.) and a sharp cannabis tones attack the nose on this beer. 

The palate is the same - a good crisp bitterness expected from the a pale ale and the hops showcase all those juicy tropical fruits. Extremely sessionable and highly recommend it as fresh as possible.

Hazy warm golden colour, white head. Pine aroma, resin, pineapple, tropical fruit, mango, passion fruit. Bitter flavour, tropical fruit, American hops. Bitter finish, malts, lots of hops. Nice!(from 75cL bottle @ Tims place. Thanks for sharing, jc1762!)

Growler from source. Pours hazy orange, fluffy white head. Aroma is full of melon, grass, resinous hop, tangerine. Flavor is gooey grassy resin hop, mango and tropical fruits & gummy bears. Super smooth, crushable, APA heaven.

Pours a hazy orange and an aggressive pour produced almost three fingers of a white, foamy head.

Mmm, very fruity on the nose with pineapple and grapefruit leading the charge. Believe it or not theres also a creme or sherbert smell to it too. Hidden in back are some earthy hops.

Those earthy hops on the nose are slightly subdued, but present nonetheless. The middle of the mouth picks up acidic orange.tangerine and grapefruit. Theres almost a flowery/potpourri taste in addition to the fruits which actually makes for a nice combo. The finish is quite bitter with a big hop presence which is unusual because that typically tends to happen up front. Im not going to be writing any complaints to Trillium about it, but Im just sayin. 

This has a light to medium body with plenty of carbonation bubbles dancing on the tongue. There are no unpleasant lingering flavors and it finishes clean with no alcohol taste.

Fort Point Pale Ale is up there with some of the best of its style. It has a nice combination of hop bitterness and citrus to make this a highly drinkable beer with just enough carbonation and hop bitterness to satisfy hop heads and causal drinkers.

Bottle thanks to Will. Pours a cloudy yellow gold with frothy white head that lasts. The aroma is strong citra, wheat, mangoes. Thin mouthfeel with nice juicy citrus hop, light bitterness, light dryness, very nice.

resin, citrus, floral, pale, hazy, frothy, white foam, light sweetness, medium bitterness, light body, creamy, average carbonation, great beer, dry finish, hop flavor without an overpowering bitterness,

UPDATED: NOV 16, 2014 $20 (5 for liquid, 15 for container) for the 64 oz. growler purchased at the source. To oversized snifter, it pours an effervescent web color orange with which a foam-whitish head 1½ fingers in length stood. Aromas of sawdust, papaya, quinces, Midwest hops, American hops, polyethylene, unripe pineapple, tangerine zest, and vanillin. Tatses the same with the addition of guava, avocados, cotton duck, sidewalk chalk, and minerals. Soft and refreshing. Moderately astringent,  like Adam said, but I appreciate those kinds of flavors so finishing my glass hadnt been difficult.

Bomber, 2 weeks old stored @ fridge temp. light yellow to orange pour. Nose is bursting with citrus, dried grapefruit skins and sweet mango. Taste is crisp, malty and graham cracker. its a slight astringent and difficult to finish a glass but overall they nailed the nose and mouthfeel.

bomber shared, pours a medium cloudy yellowish orange color. nice frothy head. citrus and pine nose and nice malt base. flavor is sooo smooth. its omg smooth. mildly bitter but the hops are very present in the medium malt base. lots of citrus and fruit notes from the hops and some minor pine. this is an amazing beer that finishes very dry...love it.

Bottle from FedEx. smell is danky and a ton of Citra hops. some underlying mosaic sorta thing going on too. pour is murky, cloudy, dark orange. actually a very unattractive looking beer. Taste starts with a slightly tropical note and full mouthfeel, but not too sweet. A rounded bitterness starts to come through as you drink it. Overall, the aroma is amazing, but the flavor seems to fall a bit short. While still enjoyable, and very good, I find the best hoppy beers are able to bring that through in the flavor with a bright hop flavor, which is modest and muddled in this beer. Id drink it at a bar, but I wouldnt go out of my way to get another bottle.

Bottle, big thanks to Bruce, split at CBC Clerko 30/09/14.
Rich orange/light amber with a decent off white covering.
Nose is bitter dank hops, pissy twang, pine, tangerine, juicy citricisms.
Taste comprises orange pith, pine licks, skuny hoppage, apricot, tangerine, light spice.
Medium bodied, fine carbonation, juicy hop rinse in the close.
Solid IPA - top notch!
user_location: Hazlemere, the lower Xhitlerns, Buckinghamshire, ENGLAND

text: 30th September 2014Craft Clerkenwell. Bottle tasting. Big thanks to Bruce for this one. Lightly hazy gold beer, small pale cream colour head. Nose of light citrus and a hint of brett. Nice palate - very airy with mild fine carbonation. Lovely light malts, a modicum of creamy sweetness. Hops are a great mix of mild to medium skunk, light pine, juicy orange and mild peel. Light finish with a mild skunky linger. Lovely beer, so light and well joined up and so very drinkable.

Bottle, big thanks to Bruce. It pours golden with a small white head. The nose is fresh, juicy,sherbet, lemon, pine needles, dough, key lime pie and passion fruit. The taste is crisp bitter, sherbet, soapy lemon, minerals, alka seltzer, plenty of tropical fruits with a dry finish. Medium body, moderate carbonation and foamy mouth-feel. Nose beats the taste, but that aint too shabby either. Well rounded and very drinkable. Nice work!
75cl, new exclusive American brew Anno 2013, thx alot to Maarten for sharing!, complex bitter brew, fruity/woody and slightly bitter/spicy, balanced, cloudy, good head, very good brew

Draft @ Armsby Abbey. Unfiltered gold, lasting lacing down the side. Aroma is off the chain! Mangos, peach, pineapples.... Tons of fruit! Light hints of straw. The bitterness is mild and lingering with dry pine to balance the amazing amount of fruit. The palate is dry with a citrus pith. Nice wheat base. Overall, for a standard IPA I could crush this all day long, super drinkable, love it!

[ Keg ][ 2oz ][ Trillium ][ Free ][ Plastic Cup ][ 5.29.14 ]
>> Pours low haze straw to near green with white foam and excellent lacing. Nose is fresh citrus and house characteristic sourdough bread and pilsner malt grist. Taste is dry and sourdough focused, pilsner malt and stone ground rustic flavor. Palate is light and grassy bitter. Bright beer and very good all around. Would love it on a regular basis.

Hyper aromatique, lichee, fruit de la passion, mangue, agrumes sucrés dans un corps céréalier et laiteux. Buvabilité incestueuse.Earlier Rating: 8/25/2013 Total Score: 4.1Un growler de la brasserie qui explose littéralement en aromatique. Hyper chargé dagrumes avec une amertume délicate, solide buvabilité!

Super fresh, awesome beer. Pours cloudy yellow with good head and lacing. Lots of piney hops in this with some grapefruit. Best IPA Ive had in a long time, very hop-forward and well-done. Thanks to someone at Churchkey for sharing some of this bottle. Great stuff.

UPDATED: DEC 27, 2016 From a growler shared at DC Beer Week. Copper pour with an off white head. Fruity aroma. Flavors of pine resin. Nicely balanced and tasty IPA.
Update based on a fresh can from the brewery. Good stuff.
Great aroma and nice pale, slightly Amber pour. Hoppy, but not as citrusy as it smells. Clean finish, well balanced bitterness. Good solid pal ale, but prefer the CCB Invasion to this

UPDATED: SEP 17, 2014 7/20/2013 Total Score: 3.9 32oz growler poured into a tulip. Pours hazy golden/copper with a lacy, off-white head. Aroma of a lot of citrusy and tropical fruity hops, some caramel and pale malts, a light wheat note, and a little spice. Flavor the same with waves of fruity and citrusy hops plus nice wheat and malt balance. Average texture. A really good pale ale.
650 ml bottle. No nose on it, jsut caramel. The flavor bring light fruits and a bit of dank, still a bit sweet.

big bottle acquired in trade. superb grapefruit/mango/peach nose. soft body sweet malts with biscuity flavor as it warms, some spiciness on sidesof tongue & some lemon rind tingles. finishes hoppy with complex fruity/bitterness. delicious.

Thanks to Rian for sharing! Very floral in the nose, fresh, smooth. The beer starts fresh, very fresh-hoppy, not too sweet, nice and smooth. The mainpart is smooth-fresh, slightly sweetish with lots of floral hops, that fit in the sweetish-floral aroma. The aftertaste is smooth, sweetish, floral, nice fresh and very smooth! 13/12/13/13

Bottle: Thanks, Tim. Cloudy amber-orange body with sunshine edges & a chunky, eggshell froth that lasts for a while on top. Chunky lacing all around. Aroma of grass, juicy mango, mild Munich-like malt sweetness, dirty earth, & some herbaceous, dank notes trending towards the back half. Taste incorporates a nice, smooth bitterness with lots of grassy & leafy hops. Light malt sweetness, like toasted pale malt, just bordering outside of the CaraMunich realm. Mid-palate brings out mango & other vague, dripping wet tropical fruits. Slightly juicy. Passion fruit. A touch of back-end herbal spiciness, almost a little white pepper-y, with a lingering & fading mango finish. A very tasty & well done pale ale.

Bottle at home, shared with Mathieu87.
APPEARANCE: clear blond beer, small unstable white head.
NOSE: simco, hoppy, fruity, sweet.
TASTE: simco, bitter, little dry, little sweet, fruity, hoppy.
This is pretty awesome IPA, the beer is amazing a lot of citrus with some tropical notes, slightly less heavy than most beers yet not as bitter as I would expect from the amount of hop flavor
Bottle. Pours golden orange with a white head. Clean pale malty base with piney hops, tropical fruity notes, and a nice resinous piney finish. Really good.

Sample @ RBWG, Asheville. Gold pour with a small head. Pretty dank herbal hop. Some of that heady leaf, lemon peel and flower petals. The taste is very fresh and bright. Fruitier than the nose would suggest. Tropical mango and melon. Brash shoots and grass. Light body, zippy and active. Great stuff.

750mL Bottle. Catty, pungent pine and plastic nose. Intense and aromatic, but in a way focusing on the grating, coarse less desirable aromas of the new American hops. The plastic lime of Citra, the cat urine of Simcoe, the papaya seed and flint of Chinook and relatives. This essence translates over to the flavor, where some of these more ragged, beefy plant characters become softer tangerine, orange, and some pellet dust. Prickly and warm. I appreciate the balance of hop aroma and flavor to bitterness, but Im not particularly enjoying the coarse, grating bite of the hop characters. Theres not a lot of backbone, either, with noticeable heat. Overbearing in the wrong dimensions. I wouldnt buy this again.

Growler says "Double Dry Hopped Fort Point Pale Ale". Handsome appearance w/stubbornly retentive head & lace. 

Bangin' aroma of juicy Citra hops, tropical fruits, other awesomeness. Hearty (fruity) hop profile on the palate, nearly zero bitterness, no shortage of flavor. Quite impressive for a pale ale.

(Growler) cloudy, light gold with soapy offwhite bubbles. Nose is fresh, citrus peel, grapefruit, and honey. Taste is medium bitter, grapefruit peel, pine, medium sweetness, well balanced, awesome IPA.

UPDATED: MAR 24, 2015 Cant imagine a beer smelling better than this, tropical fruitiness is off the charts (pineapple, grapefruit, mango). Comes through in the flavor along with a nice malt backbone. Dry finish, lovely!

*5th time having it and I love it more now than before.  Had to up the ratings.  Its damn near perfect.
Bottle - pours hazy gold w/ white frothy head. The nose is piney, evergreen, and lemon zest. The taste is smooth, sticky, and grapefruit to a bitter finish. Solid!!!

750ml bottle dated 5/14, pours cloudy toasted orange with a finger of head. Nose is juicy orange zest, lemon, mango, touch of cereal. Taste is similar with some nice fruity orange slice, lemon, melon, honey, with subtle toasted crackery malt. Finish is bittery dry citrus, lemon, cantaloupe. Pretty good but not really anything mind-blowing.

UPDATED: MAY 29, 2014 Bottle from brewery. Pours cloudy yellow gold with white head. Nose/taste of pineapple, citrus zest, toasted malt, lemon, a touch of resinous spruce/pine and toasted grass. Medium body. Delicious!

750 bottle shared from MaxxDaddy, 5 days old. Very pale pour, moderately cloudy. Ridiculously fresh aroma; ripe tomato, pine, mozzarella. Mmmm. It kind of smells like pizza, in an awesome way. Dangerously Drinkable indeed, with a solid body, very dry, fresh hop and a balance way in the direction of hops. The kind of beer that will quickly make you regret tomorrow morning if you find it on tap.

Growler 1L. Couleur orangée pâle légèrement trouble, mousse blanche onctueuse et éternelle laissant une belle dentelle. Arôme avalanche de fruits tropicaux, ananas, mangue, floral, malt. Goût de mangue, houblon résineux, malt craquant, amertume toute en longueur, herbal en arrière-goût. Carbonatation moyenne-élevée, corps moyen.

Was listed as a Pale Ale at Lord Hobo, but definitely tasted like an IPA; would have been the best Pale Ale Id ever had. Hazy gold, nice foamy white head. Big citrus and resin hop aroma, bitter citrus flavor with toasted malt and yeast notes.

The beer pours a pale, greenish yellow with a nice, quarter fingers width head of eggshell-white bubbles. In body, the beer is clear and clean with a slight chill haze, but no visible particles and a nice lazy carbonation. On the nose, the beer is a beautiful bouquet of Citra hops. Mango and tropical fruit blend with spicy pine needles, pine resin, and a just a faint whiff of cattiness. On the tongue, the beer tastes bitter, yet balanced by cracker smooth malt sweetness. Soft citric acidity snaps at the start and finish of the sip, providing nice, yet drinkable complexity. In flavor, the beer begins as lemon juice and pine, slowly unfurling into pine and tropical juice with a nice balancing cracker malt and light prickly, light pineapple flavors. The finish is a crisp burst of juicy fruit, cracker malt, and lime zest, and the aftertaste is soft and tame, ringing with bitter medicine, pine, and citrus. In the mouth, the beer feels crisp and on the light side of medium in body. Carbonation is soft, and the beer provides a nice smooth blanket for the tongue, even though it remains crisp as an overall sip. Overall, this is a great hoppy pale ale. Bitterness is definitely the dominant feature here, and the Citra hop definitely shines, making this a wonderfully balanced hoppy beer with great complexity. This is a borderline IPA, and I personally would label it as such, as the malt balance isnt quite where I like it for an APA. Overall this is a tremendously quaffable, hoppy pale ale with some great refreshing flavor. A beer to try!

Growler filled at brewery and opened five days later. Pours a beautiful hazy gold, like pulpy orange juice. Aroma leaps out of the glass, super pungent, signaling that youre in for something great: lychee, mango, pine, orange, tropical-fruit explosion. Really great. Taste is pineapple, grapefruit pith, Asian pear, passionfruit, and lingering but not too pronounced bitterness. Very balanced. Clean. Creamy. Remarkable pale ale/IPA hybrid right up there with some of the styles trendsetters.

Hazy golden orange color with a dense, frothy, white head. Ripe fruit aroma of grapefruit, citrus, peach, mango, and pale malt. A smidgen of sweetness rounded out by hop bitterness. Crisp mouthfeel, moderately carbed, and refreshing. Dry finish of light bitterness.

My Bottom Line:
Lively citrus, sandy and piney hop resins make this IPA a truly compelling pint for the hophead.

Further Personal Perceptions:
-A sturdy head of foam laces around the cloudy pale straw.
-The coniferous hop bitterness is as intense as the aroma. This is chock-full of hop aroma, flavor AND finish. And all is brightly expressed.
-Calling this a Pale Ale is quite deceiving. This is hoppier than many IPAs!
-Drinkability is perhaps lower than average due to the intensity of the bitterness.
-If you are turned off by the cat litter component of some hops, you might not like this brew.

On tap at Lord Hobo.

UPDATED: JAN 20, 2016 Draft at Deep Ellum on 2/14/14Mild haziness in the deep golden body and topped by a firm, fluffy white head that shows fair retention.Nicely hoppy in the nose, providing plentiful C-hop notes; orange, grapefruit some light mango and pineapple and pretty low on the hop resin or alcohol. Lightly sweet malts provide honey and touches of cream-of-wheat notes with a clean yeast (despite the haziness). Medium-high to high strength of aroma.Even better in the flavor, amazingly enough. Full of fruity hoppiness and moderately bitter citrus with only a kiss of pine on the end, culminating in more tropical fruits as it warms and a balancing but quite dry pale maltiness. Soft, almost creamy mouthfeel and no hop acid burn make this a standout beer and just an all-around well-done IPA. Certainly the best these guys offer and one Id happily drink any time. I like that the abv (while still high, objectively) is relatively low for the style. Would like to see a completely bright sample, which must be phenomenal if its this good with some sediment in it.  8/4/8/4/16Bottled January 2016 and drunk 1/15/16.Been needing to rerate this thing.  Amazing stuff and this batch just as good as any of the best.  Glad to see a return to form with the haziness and head retention.  As well, the beer is delightfully hoppy with a perfect texture, tons of juicy fruit and citrus.  Between this and the Enigma version, its very close for me as to which one I prefer, but regardless, both excellent beers.  Score reflects this bottle.

Tap. Hazy, white orange pour with a finger of head that seem to last forever. Citrus, citrus peel, fruit juice. Powerful and juicy aroma. Body is medium but lighter than expected. Slight bitterness with a long fruity but bitter finish. Very nice

Growler shared at RBWG, Friday night tasting at the roach motel. This is the kind of garbage juice Loines drinks, so it must be good. Pours a hazy, pale gold with a small white ring for a head. Very clean - citrusy and herbal hops, sweet and pale and wheat and cereal malts, and some grass. Light-bodied, with moderate carbonation and a clean mouthfeel. Excellent APA.

Hazy lemon yellow pour. Looks like a witbier. Creamy bone white head. Tons of lacing in the glass. Aroma initially is of actual hop pellets. Smells like sticking your nose in the fridge at the homebrew store. Then pineapple and mango come out. Lime and white grapefruit as well. Flavor is a huge hit of all kinds of juicy fruity hop flavors. This is citra dominated, so pineapple, mango and other tropical fruit are at the lead. Tons of that hop pellet dust flavor of pure unadulterated hops all over. Malt is light and understated. Just enough to contribute a light honey and biscuit foundation for hops to dance all over. Bitterness is ample and a bit strong for a pale, but softened by the aggressive juiciness of the hops. Palate is full and wet, completely thirst quenching. I cant get enough of this beer. A growler goes too fast. Everything Ive had from Trillium has been solid, but this is the standout, must try beer.

Growler thanks to WillRunForBeer! Pours cloudy golden amber, small creamy white head, nice lacing. Aroma is very citra-esque with a great combination of pine, citrus, dank forest floor, cat poss. Flavor is the same, light sweet and light bitter but bursting with hop flavors. Full body for the style, quite creamy mouthfeel. Reaching Pseudo Sue levels of quality here.

Growler shared by Leighton, thanks! Pours a hazy pale yellow with a white head that dissipates to the edges. Aroma has bit of a dank pine note with a grass, citrus and sweet grain backing. Flavor has bitter citrus up front with a bit of light fruit but finish is dank pine and resin.

Growler shared with bytemesis. Opaque color, golden orange, some foam but it mostly disappears quickly. Citrus dominated smell with some dank. There is more there that i dont have the patience to pick out. Suffice to say it is very pleasantly aromatic. Taste is pine resin bitter, or bitter greens, grass, a little metallic at times. Standout for a pale ale, very flavorful.

RBWG14 Trip Rating #25. Growler shared by Leighton at the Friday Night Downtown Inn Bottle Share. Pours a hazy orange color with a thin fizzy tan head. Aroma of floral, citrus, herbal hops and pale malts. The taste is pale malts, herbal and floral hops. Medium bodied.
Bottle at RBWG, courtesy of leighton. Pours a hazy golden color with white head. Citrus, grapefruit, tropical fruit flavors.

Growler. Pours pale yellow gold with a big sticky white head. Aromas of pine, citrus and mango. Pale malt backbone takes a back seat to mango, citrus, hop. Pine resin bitterness, then a touch of mango returns after the swallow. Theres also a bit of onion in the finish that knocks this down a touch from greatness.
Growler. Hell of a pale ale. I could drink this email every day!!!! This was better than most pale ales.
Sample from growler light yellow Nose huge weedy grass and resin. Taste similar to nose, Great aromatic hop. Mid palate very smooth and thick mouth. Light bitter and floral hop finish. Awesome pale.

Growler to snifter (thanks Leighton). Looks good; a hazy golden orange with white lacing. Smells good too; citrus hops and a touch of tartness with a well-balanced pale malt backbone. An incredible example of the style.
Pale yellow pour with creamy white head and lace. Aroma is light malt and a touch of citrus hops. Semi sweet malt with a nice grapefruit bitter finish. Medium body with good carbonation. nice beer

Taster from a 32oz growler. Medium body. Smooth, lighter carbonation. More dry finish. Good zesty citrusy taste. Light spice. Moderate bitter light sweet. Mostly hazy golden orange color. Thin off-white head. Dots of lace. Smooth, lighter pale ale. Nice light biscuity malt. Solid, zesty, citrusy hoppy pale ale. Holy shit, this has a 4.1 score? What? This is a great, hoppy zesty pale ale. Just didnt blow my mind at this moment. Doesnt quite have the balance of the best examples of the style, maybe. Sue me.

From Growler. Nice and hoppy aroma (would have guessed IPA based on aroma) - floral, pine, and citrus. Tastes a tad bit of a let down as I was expecting that in your face hoppiness that was the aromas.
UPDATED: NOV 28, 2014 Pours hazy gold into a tulip. White head with medium retention recedes to hug rim. Citrus and mint aromas. Sweet yeast and citrus upfront turning to a lasting pith finish.

Growler from the brewery. Pours clear gold with a large, frothy white head. Lovely pissy hops in the nose, loads of citrus, lemon, papaya. Light to medium sweet flavor with further tangy urine, tangeine, lemon, faint pine needles, perfectly balanced pale malt sugars. Light to medium bodied with fine, smooth carbonation. Extremely well balanced to finish, bursting with citrusy and juicy hops, slight pale bread. Absolutely stunning. I could drink this by the bucket. Without a doubt world-class.

Pours an unusual hazy orange with a white cap of foam on top that sticks to the glass as you drink it. Delicious, grassy/grapefruit aromas with a hint of alcohol. Amazing sweet citrus flavors, orange, grapefruit, pears. The aftertaste is slightly bitter, but still dominated by sweet citrusy hops. Light, foamy yet sticky mouthfeel with little carbonation. Best finish those growlers fast, I bet this one will be flat in a day or two with the screw-off lid. 

This is what a radler should taste like (if they didnt all suck), it would be awesome after a long bike ride on a sticky-hot day. Only downside is Trillium being limited to growlers and kegs for now, they could be a national name if they could start canning. This was poured from a growler about an hour after filling into a tulip glass.

UPDATED: MAY 2, 2014 THis is really one of the best pale ales ever. Huge hop explosion with juicy tangerine, grapefruit, and lemon. Some mineral notes and a grassy herbal backbone. FInishes dry as a bone and deliciously hoppy.
UPDATED: MAY 30, 2014 Pours a pale hazy orange with a white lacing. Notes of pine, tropical fruits, rinds and dust

Pouring at BBF in Boston. Pours a hazed gold with a medium to large white head. Big musk and hops on the nose. Funky, musky, bright earthy citrus. Musky funk, long citrus with a bit of funk. Rather awesome.

Growler shared at Oxbow ! Pours a hazy orange golden color with a finger of white foam. Lots of nice citrus rind, grapefruit juicyness and some nice rustic straw and grass in the background and finish to add nice complexity and balance to the juicy citrus. Nice round soft mouthfeel. Really tasty beer !

UPDATED: OCT 6, 2013 32 oz growler offered the same day keg was filled. big potent juicy grapefruit and orangepeel hops balanced by a tropical fruit clementine sweetness. clean juicy hops. no harsh bitterness. greate.

64oz growler hits the glass and looks like pineapple juice. To call it hazy is an under statement, this is a bright orange and basically opaque. Fluffy white head. Nose is very bright, lots of fresh orange, lemon, grapefruit, some starfruit, a little tropical fruit, some light candy, grass, some chive. Flavor is spritzy, lemon, orange juice, orange rind, grapefruit zest, light honey, scallion, light pine. Dry, zesty finish. Really tasty.
Best beer of the night, hop explosion at the. Level of hill farmstead Edward or heady topper
